comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
When loitering alongside the Liffey,
You might be aware of a whiffy.
Near a Volkswagen car 
There's a leaky pissoir.
Sure the footprints will dry in a jiffy.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Bualadh bos (or applause in English)! Added to description under the photo...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
I remember the Cabinetti in Naples Railway Station back in 1977.
There was a hole in the floor. 2 chains hung from the roof with hoops on the end.
It was quite a trick to get your feet into those hoops!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: nice spring day, not sure I'd hang out near the urinals though...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] Probably a good tenet to live by - must not hang out near the urinals!  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: I guess so long as they're up wind it's ok?

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I had an idea that there was one down that direction but thought it was closer to O'Connell Bridge?  The young lady is giving the edifice a very wide berth, she is in danger of getting her clothes dirty from the car and the litter bin to avoid going close to the toilet and the males.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Passed there today, and that whole section is barricaded off with a crane in situ. Any idea what's going on?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] There was one really close to the Bridge, evident in this 1932 photo. Maybe it was still there too in 1969.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03]  I suspect that that is the one and the same as that in the earlier photo.  The depth of field gives the impression that it is further down the quay but I don't think that there was two of them.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] You're probably right. When you look at Butt Bridge, it really is fairly far away alright...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Seen from the other side of the River. Bus shelters serve the same purpose these days. maps.google.ie/?ll=53.347295,-6.257567&spn=0.001001,0...

comment.author: 24101413@N03
comment._content: Carol, work is under way on both sides of the river in preparation for the building of a new bridge, between Marlborough Street and Hawkins Street.  I havea feeling it is for buses and pedestrians only.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] And sometimes that endangered species, the telephone box too!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/24101413@N03] You're joking! Another bridge? Soon we'll have no river left...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
